critique: The document outlines amendments to an executive order concerning the election and appointment of a Chief Executive. It addresses procedures for electing a Chief Executive by the legislative body, appointment by the High Commissioner in case of legislative inaction, and the continuation of the incumbent Chief Executive until a successor is chosen. The document does not directly address topics such as immigration, security, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, most axes will be neutral. The slight increase in executive power is due to the High Commissioner's ability to appoint a Chief Executive.
